results.title: Maydina the shadow 1890's
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Two of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. This episode examines the life of Maydina and her daughter on a church mission run by a self-appointed guardian at the turn of the century. Follows her struggle to return to a tribal existence and her efforts to prevent her daughter being taken away from her by the mission guardian.

results.title: Lo-Arna 1981
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Four of the “Women of the Sun” series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women, at different periods in time. This episode is set in 1981 and examines the inner turmoil and insecurity of an 18 year old girl when her adoptive parents tell her she is not of French Polynesian descent, but is the daughter of an Aboriginal woman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films

results.title: Planning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Job Catch”.
A successful job application is dependent on careful preparation and presentation of academic record, work experience and related activities. It also requires a clear understanding of the job and the reasons for applying. “Planning” presents an easy to follow guide on how to prepare job applications. It discusses the following three points : 1.Preparation of reports, references, resumes and letters; 2.Knowledge of the job; 3.How to present a clear description of one’s self to the employer.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Performing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Job Catch”.
This film demonstrates ways in which an applicant can take a more positive role in a job interview by gaining a thorough understanding of the job interview process, thereby ensuring a more confident and relaxed attitude. Methods of utilising information on the nature of the job, and the work operations of the company or organisation are discussed, together with ways of improving performance in the job interview.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Choosing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Job Catch”.
This is part of a series designed for use by upper secondary school students and school leavers. This program shows students how to determine an appropriate career path based on their personal and creative attributes and interests. It outlines a four stage process for subject choice - self description, creating a direction, active investigation and taking action.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Coping
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Job Catch”.
This is part of series designed for use by upper secondary students and school leavers. The transition from being a student to a working young adult seeking independence can be fraught with unexpected responsibilities and financial problems. This program describes what to expect once you begin working, together with hints on basic survival techniques and personal budgeting.

results.title: Five are together again. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
With Quentin Kirrin and his wife in quarantine for scarlet fever, the children are sent to stay with Professor Hayling and his son, Tinker. An exciting adventure begins when a circus comes to town and some ‘top secret’ notes disappear from the Professor’s study.
